definition: DigitalDetox is a website that helps users selecting hotels that are offering detox holidays to help them de-stress. No Wi-Fi, zero cell reception, a tech-free attitude and lots of human interactions are the main attractions of these experiences.

Chatbots are about delivering convenience, personalization, and decision support while people are multitasking. Either for customers on the go, for allow call centers operators reach valuable information about the requirements of the multiple customers they are chatting with, or for sales associates to access details about products and customers while assisting a client.

Sensors (e.g. cameras or microphones) capture customer's images or voice to be processed using algorithms. The output are details about the profile of the customers such as mood, age or gender that can be delivered to sales associates or to call center operators to deliver an appropriate service.

Hema is a grocery store chain operated by Alibaba that provides half-hour deliveries using to Robots, apps and overhead conveyor belts to speedy the picking process. Groceries are collected by the driver from one of the multiple delivery service companies that exist in 1st tier Chinese cities that ride its motorcycle towards the delivery address.

Amazon is recruiting entrepreneurs to expand its network of partners for last mile delivery. This reduces the risk associated with relying on big powerful currier operators such as DHL or UPS. Amazon provide services to launched companies such as training, insurance packs or privileged access to vehicles.

Food With Fleur & Mike" is Sainsbury's Youtube channel starring beauty and fashion vlogger Fleur De Force and her husband, Mike, trying new recipes for the first time or attempting to cook some of their favorite dishes. Each video scores around 25,000-50,000 views.

A shift from micro influencer to nano influencers is an occasion of getting closer to the customers. To seize this opportunity, content management tools such as those provided by Tubular are required to measure all video content cross-platform, all-device, globally.

Eatizz is a Canadian startup that offers a simple and clever solution to users which are notified when shopkeeper offer discounted food (close to sales� expiry date, unsold products) in their neighborhood.

Robotic devices are used to improve the life and everyday activities of people with reduced mobility and with heavy tasks by using robotics and other devices that fit in our bodies. These devices helps with the movement.
IBM's Food Trust Ledger allows consumers to discover the whole story of the products, from farm to shelf

Structured emulsions and edible oleogels are solutions to substitute solid unhealth fats (e.g. butter) with liquid heathy fats (e.g. linen oil). This allows the production of crunchy meltable food containing fatty acids instead of saturated fats (e.g. chocolate, cookies).

The genetic metabolic analysis determines how the client digests the macronutrients (carbohydrates, proteins and fats ) which are differently digested by people. This way it is possible to recommend the diet type which is likely to work best for the client.

A2 milk is cow's milk that mostly lacks a form of ?-casein proteins called A1 and instead has mostly the A2 form which many believe causes the same gut problems as lactose intolerance. The australian A2 Milk Company claims that this milk is a result of breeding, not GMOs, brough this product to the market and has 10% of milk market share in Australia.

"Nutrino collects data on both food composition and individuals' health and, through its trademarked FoodPrint technology, combines the two to analyse how people's bodies react to different foods. It then makes personalised suggestions, recommending the foods that are the healthiest possible choices for the individual in question."

A video channel (similar to youtube) that is a new way of learning, in a more simple, faster and practical  way. The goal is to share knowledge among Worten employees, using videos produced by them. It is intended to provide new ways of learning and encourage a culture of knowledge sharing.
Robots can be applied to a variety of food production systems to improve performance.

Artificial vision promises real time analysis of video footage to monitor, control and report any visible situation with minimal-to-none human intervention. By analyzing images collected in the stores it would be possible to identify out-of-stock items, low stock items,�misplaced items, and pricing and planogram errors.
It is possible to virtually try-on beauty products that can go from makeup to glasses. Just select the wanted color and the reference, point the camera and choose which is perfect for you.

Warby Parker, is an American online retailer of prescription glasses and sunglasses. The "Home-Try-On program" allows customers to choose five frames from the website, which they receive to try on at home for five days, free of charge. Customers can also upload a photo and try on frames virtually.

Sensei and Trigon Vision are startups that aim to challenge the Amazon Go concept in other retainers. They use comouter vision to recognize what each product looks like when it goes into a customer�s hand or shopping basket, providing a scalable, seamless store-wide solution that empowers the stores of the future to be check-out and cash free.
Claire is an AI-powered assistant that "oversees all the admin of corporate travel, booking flihgts, filing expenses and assisting employees in transit".

Machine learning and optimization algorithms can look for and exploit observed patterns, correlations, and relationships among data elements of customer�s purchases. 
In this way, automatic suggestion of discounts based on previous and continuous purchases.

The Bulk Nation USA launched a program to encourage customers to bring their own containers to be filled with the products being sold in bulk at their stores. Hygiene and food safety concerns are covered in the program as well as the process to tare the containers before filling.
A way of combining renewable energy with agriculture in a hot, arid landscape, positioning elevated solar panels over an understory of plants.

SmartFlower: All-in-one solar module that includes a sun tracker and storage capacity capable of enabling off the grid buildings
Tesla solar and Powerpack systems can be used by commercial organizations to achieve greater control, reliability and security. Powerpack integrates seamlessly with solar to shave peak energy usage, lower demand charges and generate new revenue streams from grid services and demand response programs.

SmartWindow controls inside systems, such as ventilation and sun blinds, based on information about the outside conditions around the building. Simultaneously these systems are powered by patented integrated solar technology, making energy consumption go down, while the sustainable electricity production of the building goes up.

PVOH (Polyvinyl alcohol) is a synthetic polymer that degrades when is in contact with water and do not contaminate. It has no odor and is not toxic, and is resistant to grease, oils, and solvents. It is ductile but strong, flexible, and functions as a high oxygen and aroma barrier. It can be used to do plastic bags or other packagings.

OLIO connects neighbours with each other and with local shops so surplus food and other items can be shared, not thrown away.
If you love food, hate waste, care about the environment or want to connect with your community, OLIO is for you.

polyhydroxyalkanoates (PHA) are polyesters produced in nature by numerous microorganisms, including through bacterial fermentation of sugar or lipids. PHA have active properties and act as a passive barrier to reduce food waste by prolonging food shelf life. PHA can be produced using food industry by-products, such as cheese whey and almond shells, which assure the biodegradability and recyclability, and reduce food waste.
Meyash is a socially responsible sock subscription service, dedicated to celebrating the way people dress up their feet.

The �Museum of Ice Cream�  for instance is not actually a museum, but an extended Instagram backdrop. This installation, with a permanent location in San Francisco and a travelling exhibit that appeared in New York, Los Angeles and Miami, has lines around the block. Folks pay $38 to get in and take their Instagram pics in ice cream-themed settings.

Launched by Paul, Mary and Stella McCartney in 2009, Meat Free Monday is a not-for-profit campaign which aims to raise awareness of the detrimental environmental impact of eating meat, and to encourage people to help slow climate change, conserve precious natural resources and improve their health by having at least one meat free day each week.
There are 5 main endings to Black Mirror: Bandersnatch, Netflix's first adult-oriented live-action interactive experience. Each type of ending will depend on the user's choices throughout the movie.

Sweatcoin is digital currency you earn by being active. To accumulate it, you first need to download the Sweatcoin app and keep it running on your phone at all times. Any time you walk or run outside, it tracks your steps and pays you in sweatcoins (SWC). For every 1,000 steps you take, you earn just under 1 SWC.

"5 a day is any of various national campaigns in countries such as the United States, the United Kingdom, France, and Germany, to ecourage the consumption of at least five portions of fruit and vegetables"; Tesco has made it visual in all of it's compliant products

"Boxed, the bulk-shopping ecommerce retailer geared toward �updating the Costco experience for Millennials,� is implementing in its Dallas fulfillment center its autonomously guided vehicle (AGV), a lightweight, transportable alternative to larger-scale conveyor-belt systems."
"Walmart filed a patent application for a shopping cart that would track your stress levels as you're shopping and alert employees if you're internally freaking out"
